On top of this the media demonstrating the morality of the new CEO in relation to the staff gives an indication of the shape of the decision making which makes me think it is time to put into practice Jaron Lanier's argument 'Ten Arguments For Deleting Your Social Media Accounts Right Now'. Without the human customer-staff interaction all I am doing is becoming a product for a machine - time to re-engage with the real world and start gating technology as badly mediating the real world.

title: Free Speech Twitter is a Fraud, Nothing Has Changed
text: Elon Musk's Twitter doesn't care about free speech because I'm still banned for replying to Matt Walsh agreeing that the protesters who were banging on desks and spitting on the speaker at UNT should be locked up or better yet shot into the sun (joke). The reason they give NOW .. December 22: Your account has been suspended and will not be restored because it was found to be violating the Twitter Terms of Service, specifically the Twitter Rules against participating in targeted abuse. In order to ensure that people feel safe expressing diverse opinions and beliefs on our platform, we do not tolerate abusive behavior. This includes inciting other people to engage in the targeted harassment of someone.  Now obviously you can see from what I just told you I said verbatim. I was talking to MATT WALSH. I was simply STATING THE FACTS OF THE LAW. People who disturb the peace should be LOCKED UP. The shooting them into the sun part was a JOKE. IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO DO. IT IS A JOKE. And yet post-Elon Twitter said the EXACT SAME THING VERBATIM that pre-Musk twitter said. Furthermore there was no abuse of the people in question as I do not even know their identities. I am 100% sure that the protesters in question did not see my tweets and nothing I wrote incited anyone to do anything. Again I wrote two things: 1. They should be locked up. The law says that if you disturb the peace, you are committing a crime and will be arrested. The law also says if you endanger someone's health, you are committing a crime and will be arrested. Spitting on someone is endangering their health ESPECIALLY in a world where COVID exists. 2. They should be shot into the sun. An obvious joke. Nobody can shoot anyone into the sun, not even Elon Musk. THEY ARE LYING TO YOU. The reinstatement of people like Trump, Tate, etc. At best this is just because their legions of followers demanded their reinstatement, at worst it's a political theater that they're pretending to be about freedom of speech to SHUT OPPOSITION UP ABOUT IT while they quietly still censor WE THE PEOPLE who very few of us have hundreds of thousands of followers to rally for us.

title: Twitter cut me off at the knees
text: I am feeling bitter and angry at the way Twitter has handled me. I have made a couple of comments that they didn’t approve of and am permanently suspended. I have tried to talk sense with them. I have tried to negotiate.  The reasonable way to treat a human being is to suspend the account temporarily. Even a one year suspension would have taught me a valuable and hard learned lesson. My “perceived crime” does not fit the punishment. It’s unjustified, cruel and inhumane. That is why I have decided to never try to use Twitter again.  Twitter’s policies are having a hard impact on a lot of people. Famous people have complained of being cut off at the knees because of some perceived crime.  These are frivolous and vexatious accusations that don’t correspond to the reality of life. The system is designed to punish and be unnecessarily aversive in nature.  I am never going to give Twitter another opportunity to treat me this way again. I am moving on 100% to more humane platforms. I don’t want to use the “read only” option that they have given me. Twitter is too harsh on free speech expression.

title: Twitter's policies favour pro-russian trolling...
text: Twitter has moderation and banning policies in place that favour pro-russian trolls. These trolls - mainly from russia and africa - say the most horrendous things on twitter, and no one bothers them. But if you contest what they say, you are quickly banned. I'm guessing that these trolls have a system of 'mass reporting' anyone who speaks out against russia's warmaking to twitter's moderation system, which automatically reacts with a ban. I've also noticed that these pro-russian trolls tend to 'trap' people by posting tweets and comments that a person who is against russia's war will tend to react to, and then provoking them into making replies that will get them banned. All in all, it results in an online environment that is increasingly pro-russian. But more than this, twitter responds to any reported tweets with 'punishments' - it bans you, for a day, for a few days, for a week. For speaking. It bans you for speaking. I believe that this directly - directly - violates the right to free speech. I have got banned three times, and each time, I did not use abusive language. Moderation was entirely arbitrary, and punishments meted out in an arrogant and dictatorial manner. An arrogant platform, by its very arrogance and authoritarianism, assisting the propaganda of the warmongering dictatorship that is russia. It's a good site for news, but a VERY bad site for free speech. And its moderators are little dictators in their own right.

title: About 10 years ago
text: About 10 years ago, Twitter used to be a good social media platform where you could just about tweet about anything without the risk of abuse. However, roll forwards to 2016, and things started to change rather significantly and it has continued to get worse and worse. It has become a platform whereby abuse has become mainstream and conducted by anyone against anybody for any reason. Then there are the troll farms which are created by organizations or even governments to spread information, true or not, and try to sway people when it comes to political discussions. These trolls or bots are usually identifiable as they will have around 8 numbers after their name. Twitter becomes an exercise of locking down your account for a couple of weeks due to the volume of abuse. The abuse is organized as it results in a huge pile on attacks by dozens or hundreds of people with nothing else better to do in their lives. I think the abuse has reached a level where Twitter cannot really do anything about it. A British politician had brought up this matter within a bill proposed to the House of Commons, and then it later transpired that this politician was sending people defamatory accusations and abuse. The problem is endemic. If you do not have a Twitter account, for the love of God, do not sign up. It will wear you down emotionally in the long run.

title: Twitter’s systems are a joke
text: Twitter deactivated, cancelled, removed—whatever term you would like to use—our work account, because of our integrity and honesty. We set up a work account in 2009, back when there was no need to provide a date of birth. We wanted to look at getting ours verified, and it said we should enter one—even if we are a business. At no point did it say I should enter mine. So what did we put in? The most honest answer possible, the first day of trading in 1997. The AI came down like a ton of bricks, saying we were underage. I should note that Twitter’s own account would fall foul of this requirement! And what if I had hired a 20-something social media manager who put in their date of birth? The same thing would have happened. I thought: surely this will be a pretty routine matter to clear up? Twitter requested ‘government-issued ID’ that showed my face, my name, and date of birth. So far a driver’s licence and two passports (I have dual nationality) have not worked. They then moved the goalposts saying I could not be verified as the account owner. This is despite the account having the same IP as me, and all responses coming from the same email address which I signed up with. Oh, on that note, a USPTO trade mark registration and Wikipedia entries are insufficient to prove my ownership. I mentioned it to a Twitter executive I knew, and he referred it to their internal support team. I have heard sweet F. A. from them. This has been going on since October 2021. Twitter even had the cheek to send me an email, one month after my last submission of proof, to say that they would like to close the case since it had been resolved. Basically, they do nothing, they just send meaningless, programmed responses. Even their trade mark department sent an autoresponse with a link … to a 404. I guess they are so inefficient or incompetent that making US$4,000 million in revenue a year isn’t enough to do the basics. Or maybe they like censorship. It’s a matter of record that they’ve closed down antiwar and Occupy accounts. I used to think Facebook, Inc. was bad, but when our work Instagram was deactivated there, they actually had humans respond to us and everything was back in a week.  As someone who personally joined Twitter when it was still Twttr in 2007, I’m disappointed that their systems are so terrible, and that every move they have made to date has been farcical. A written letter is now before their New Zealand office’s lawyers but if the above is typical of Twitter, then I will expect another farcical response.

title: Probably the most harmful site on the internet
text: So, being a Leeds United fan and having played Southampton yesterday, we were winning 1-0 and James Ward Prowse scored a great goal to equalize, Sky sports then posted a post match interview with him and I jokingly responded with this "@SkySportsPL You absolute Melon James, You cost us 2 points yesterday with that free kick lol I hope you trip over a daisy and injure your toe 😆" A bit of football banter and a jokey comment. Within minutes, my account was permanently blocked and I was banned from Twitter for, and I quote 'Violating our rules against abuse and harassment. You may not engage in the targeted harassment of someone, or incite other people to do so. This includes wishing or hoping that someone experiences physical harm. What the absolute chuff is this? Twitter is a site that allows and more often than not, encourages, people to attack other people for thier sex, gender, race, social standing, they allow insults and name calling, aggressive Hashtag movements, I see almost on a daily basis, people verbally attacking each other and arguing about gender and race politics, slandering each other with ists, isms, and all manor of other labels and yet what get's someone banned and blocked is a silly joke and a bit of banter over a football match.  I'm at a complete loss for words. This toxic site really needs to be closed down because they're a health risk to society. They allow and encourage arguments and hate slander but attack and ban people without any warning for having a bit of a laugh. I had another account blocked and banned last year for making a comment on a story about a man who kidnapped, raped and murdered a child, I simply said 'this is why the death penalty should be brought back for people like this' and my account was blocked for 'spreading hate speech' Yet there was 100's of other comments on the same thread saying far worse and far more offensive things about said killer. Twitter should be banned and shut down until they get thier act together, they cherry pick what's deemed offensive and what's not and 90% of the time, they allow really hurtful offensive material and ban and block silly jokes or throw away comments. It's pathetic. They're playing with people's mental health, violating freedom of speech and are causing a lot of issues. It's ridiculous. I have appealed my case 3 times to them and not once have I had a reply from a human being, all I have had to all 3 of my appeals, all asking for information and detailing certain points I would like addressed regarding my suspension, is the EXACT same copied and posted 5 lines of text telling me my account has been suspended for 'violating Twitters rules' and will not be re-opened. These lot are criminals, plain and simple, they have zero user care, zero customer service to deal with issues and problems and they literally block and ban whoever they want and for any reason using bots and algorithms. There's not a human face to be had and appealing your case is 95% of the time, a pointless exorcise. Despicable site that should not legally be allowed to trade and exist in its current form.

title: I was on Twitter for 7 years
text: I was on Twitter for 7 years. I mainly joined because I wanted people to check out my website. I started to see changes on Twitter in 2018 that had me convinced that the social media website was left-wing leaning. Different Conservatives were being censored who were running for public office. Twitter would then censor Conservative news if it was from a reliable source. It was uncomfortable the last 2 & 1/2 years that I was on Twitter. Twitter was once a free speech social media site; have become a Liberal free speech site that I couldn't stand being on there anymore. Twitter is less appealing and sadly a lot of other social media sites are starting to be less appealing like Twitter. Tumblr is one of a few social media websites that don't censor or suspend Conservatives. For those who love to blog, share pics, quotes, and videos, etc., Tumblr is strongly recommended. I would also encourage people to check out Gettr and Gab alternatives to Twitter.

text: Nothing much more to say, the site is completely "Woke" and will ban, delete and remove anyone who is not a person of colour for racial slurs. I've just been kicked off of the site because I got into an argument with a racist black guy who was all over the site calling various white people all manor of awful racist names. He called me a bunch of horrible disgusting things pertaining to my skin colour and ethnicity and when I responded in kind, I was immediately banned and blocked. I had to write an essay and appeal the decision and it's now been over 2 weeks and I've not even had a reply from them over it. All the while, this black guy who racially abused me is still on site and still abusing other white people. Using terms like "White monkey" "Thin lips" "Mayonnaise face" and other such racial slurs. Yet making comments on his "Black" features in response immediately gets you banned, reported and removed as a racist. This is not how you deal with online abuse and racism. There has to be a zero tolerance approach to it all or none at all. You can't just pick one group of people and say it's against your terms and conditions for them to abuse others and then allow other groups of people to abuse them. This is not how equality and stopping online abuse works. Maybe someone should explain this to Twitter.  Racial abuse and online slander is completely allowed on there if you are a POC. All this does is drive a bigger wedge through already frayed racial tensions. I know lots of white people who have been banned for merely standing up for themselves after being racially abused on there, yet Twitter has this view that racial abuse is only racial abuse when it's aimed at POC. There are loads of black people on the site who constantly post racial slurs and attacks and when confronted, they explode into a fit of racial slander, they've been reported and nothing ever gets done about it. Twitter, a site where racism and hatred is not just allowed but encouraged against white people. This is NOT equality. Oh and as a footnote, this is now the 3rd time I have been kicked off of Twitter, the other 2 times were for posting comments about how vile a convicted baby killer was and another about how I thought a serial rapist and murderer deserved the death penalty, Twitters reasoning? I was spreading hate speech. So by thier logic you also have to be nice to murderers, rapists and convicted baby killers. It just shows what this site has become.

title: Twitter has become the dictator of content
text: Twitter has become the dictator, judge, and jury of their inconvenient truth! They use the technicality of the law to justify their immoral decision to censor content simply because they want to interfere with the American peoples access to information and ideas. Over time their censorship will be destructive to the noble purpose and ideals of the open Internet. Twitter has become the publisher of the content posted. There are legal consequences to what they are doing. Law Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act It states.  (c) Protection for “Good Samaritan” blocking and screening of offensive material (1) Treatment of publisher or speaker No provider or user of an interactive computer service shall be treated as the publisher or speaker of any information provided by another information content provider. So it’s time for the big social media giants to finally choose if they are a publisher or a platform. No matter what kind of legal weasel words they choose to use to justify their decisions. It doesn’t matter if it’s a human or a machine algorithm making the editorial decision – if you are blocking or censoring some content that doesn’t agree with your values and viewpoints, then you are a publisher. Period. It’s time for social media companies to wake up to that reality and be prepared for the consequences.

title: Twitter Is The Absolute Worst Social Media Platform In The World !
text: Twitter is the absolute worst social media platform in the world ! They suspend people's accounts over little and nothing as well as very negligible things.My Twitter account @KSybaritic was recently suspended for no valid reason at all on Saturday January 9th ,2021 and despite the fact that I have made countless appeals, I still haven't gotten a single response and it has now been well over a week and counting. This is an experience  that innumerable other users have unfortunately encountered. Twitter doesn't care at all about their users and has the most abysmal customer service that I have ever seen in my life ! They only want to exploit their users for profit ,and then discard as well as ostracize them as soon as they inevitability show there imperfections as a human being .They use a completely flawed algorithm and bots to frequently suspended, scrutinize ,spy on ,and ban people from Twitter. Twitter incessantly changes their  rules  all the time so one thing that wouldn't get you reprimanded one moment can readily have that happen in another . Jack Dorsey needs to be fired as their CEO as soon as possible ! He is a social media dictator who engenders unmitgated limitations to people's freedom of speech . Twitter has become analogous to the Orwellian novel of 1984 since they behave just like Ingsoc, The Thought Police and Jack Dorsey is a scruffy,ignorant, and ,glorified hippie Big Brother wannabe/reject . I definitely wouldn't recommend Twitter to my worse enemy because it has become a virtual dystopian society . Users are certainly sooner or later going to abandon Twitter en masse in search of other social media venues that actually foster freedom of thought as a volitional right . Twitter offers a patheticly ersatz and entirely poor imitation of and dearth of freedom. They will not last another 10 years as a company at this rate. They should be ashamed of themselves and are a consummate disgrace to the social media community ! I hope and pray that this negative review will help and convince people not to waste their valuable time to create a Twitter account with this very callous ,corrupt, dictatorial,  avaricious, and autocratic company  ! They are so replete with corruption  that as of this writing you can't  even post an honest  positive or  negative review about them on Google reviews without getting an error message, and Yelp for Twitter is nonexistent. There needs  to be laws enacted and implemented that keep scrofulous social media companies like Twitter  from becoming  despotic by flagrantly abusing their powers . Users  need to have rights  that prevent them from being oppressed by Twitter.

title: Twitter has no humans working in Customer Service
text: My account was locked on October 6th, 2020 for 'hateful conduct'.  I have not violated their rules as I understand them.  I have been trying for almost 3 months to get my account unlocked but my emails generally are ignored.  There is no one accountable at Twitter and their suspensions seem random and biased towards right wing accounts. Since 30 days have lapsed, Twitter has removed my historical content.  I repeat.  There is no person, link or phone number provided by Twitter to voice a complain to. When I worked in IT, we had logs and data trails to review processes historically.  Twitter has billions in revenue so they can afford to take responsibility for their actions.  I want my account unlocked, my history restored and want Twitter to be held accountable when their algorithms flag accounts for suspension randomly.  No one should have an indefinite suspension of their Twitter account without cause.  I have also issued a complaint about Twitter to the FTC.

title: Custom Support are a disgrace!
text: Love twitter it's super fun however you can get suspended and accused of violating twitter rules when you literally haven't done anything wrong and then when someone harassed YOU on there and you have evidence and twitter support say the person didn't violate their rules.. In 2015 I had a guy harass me on there for blocking him. He then proceeded to make new accounts (each time admitting it was him) and he even DM'D me on twitter saying he'd keep making accounts just to harass me on there. I reported him and provided the evidence and they said he wasnt violating their rules!  Different situation that's unrelated. I retweeted a video that I related to. Just a stand up comedy that featured Ricky Gervais. Put a caption that didn't mention names saying I had the same thing happen to me (as what Ricky was explaining in the video) next thing you know I get suspended because Twitter decided the retweet "violated their rules" supposedly something to do with hate speech, racism, harassing..Huh?? No names were mentioned, it wasnt threatening and it was no worse than I've seen on twitter many MANY times before. YET they suspended my account because of the retweet. They didn't see me being harassed in 2015 as a violation even when the guy admitted it in a message that I sent Twitter but a RETWEET that agreed to a point made by a comedian THAT was a suspend worthy violation? Riiight...also I've seen PORN on Twitter and I've seen people spread hate about MANY people and not get suspended. Mine was agreeing to a hilarious and very true stand up comedy about those scumbags who take random posts personal when the person posting doesn't even know them so it could be about anyone. I was agreeing to that cause it happened to me. Twitter suspended me and took down the tweet and threatened to take some my account.  Twitter support are obviously morons if they don't actually know what threatening, hate speech, racism and harassment is and SELECTIVELY suspend you for literally no reason. They're absolutely disgraceful and should be ashamed of themselves. As for twitter itself I enjoy it a lot. I do wish there was an edit option on our tweets though and I wish we could write more (very little space to write) some argue they prefer it like that.  P.S If they do take down my account i'll just rejoin and continue retweeting as apparently making multiple accounts isn't a violation according to you circa 2015 so...  👍

title: Twitter Navigation
text: Twitter is one of the leading social media platforms in the world, and I see why; it's informative, full of content, active and widely available therefore the community is huge meaning there is always someone to interact with.  The navigation around the site isn't as self explanatory as some others, this may be as it is very full, whereas other websites stick to a more simple dashboard.  Also sometimes I find it hard to find content I am looking for as there is so much it's hard to filter for what you're really looking for. Another thing to bear in mind is that every post you like, comment or retweet will show up on your profile page, this can be a negative aspect of the site to some.  Overall Twitter has many benefits, hence it's tremendous success, it can seem overwhelming to beginners however you will get used to it if you spend time getting to know it.

title: Government Censorship Through Private Corps
text: Since the US government cannot constitutionally censor dissidents thanks to the Bill of Rights, they do so through "private" corporations like Twitter. Over the years, I have collected numerous screenshots of Twitter censorship in action and a company blacklist was even discovered by hackers. Look it up. Whether you criticize illegals wars, occupations, war criminals, make jokes, expose war crimes, or even create parodies of criminals like Jeffrey Epstein, the Twitter team will be there to censor you on the spot using various methods whether banning a search of your name, hiding your replies, or simply deleting your account without any warning or explanations. Twitter also collects phone numbers to blacklist people so if you try signing up again, you will find yourself automatically blacklisted. Basically if you don't go along with whatever the government does, especially foreign policy, you'll find Twitter putting up walls all around you to put you in your own echo chamber and eventually purging you.

title: When they're good they're good, when they're BAD they're VERY BAD
text: I have been using Twitter for personal use for quite a few years and have been rather dis-satisfied with the "service". When a "service" is unreliable, cannot be sorted out when things go wrong, and when Support staff are totally unreachable - it is not a "service" it is a hindrance.  I WOULD NEVER USE TWITTER FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES – IT IS TOO UNRELIABLE. I have several personal accounts and for the past week I have been unable to Tweet.  This has occurred several times now. When I send a Tweet, I see the message "Your Tweet was sent" - but in fact it hasn't. The Tweet appears on my Timeline - but does not appear on the destination Timeline. VERY DECEIVING. I know that the Tweet has NOT been sent because I am able to check using another account. It seems that quite often I find my accounts have been severely restricted rendering them unusable. And what is worse, I discover that my more recent Tweets have been deleted. I am not aware of any reason why my accounts have been restricted. I am not given a reason by Twitter why they have been restricted. I don't even know if they have been deliberately restricted by Twitter or if it is a system bug. If you want evidence of my claim, just look at more of these reviews on Trustpilot, even better, look at the “@Twittersupport” page on Twitter itself. Finally I repeat, don’t rely on Twitter for a Business.

title: Twitter hates conservatives
text: Twitter is another social media site amongst the top but wears a phony crown upon its head. When it first began, it may have been very good, but as time passed, politics took over as it has with so many others and now conservative posts subject the author to shadow banning. The only way you can truly survive is if you follow the narrative of the left-wing. This site needs to be reformed.

title: Possibly being controlled by Right wing…
text: Possibly being controlled by Right wing Governments & unsurprisingly with the lack of enforcement of local tax laws.... The decision to stop certain right wing individuals names from trending & the upholding of suspensions to accounts who clearly haven’t breached hate rules, but may have used colourful language, is a clear attempt to stifle free speech from people criticising Current governments. But money talks & like a lot of Social media technology companies, the willingness to be controlled or influence behaviour for political capital has become too much & it is time for new platforms to start eroding their market share.

(they also changes UKBLM to BLMUK in a post where i pointed out possible liabilities) This means i did not type those words, but twitter has post edited my post and made it look like i wrote something i did not. title: I had been a member of Twitter for…
text: I had been a member of Twitter for years and had suffered abuse before for my views. I had previously reported abusers to twitter but they refused to take action then I set up a petition and within 24 hours it had over 2000 signatures and i set up a link for this petition on my twitter page.The petition was on the Care2petition website. Care2petition emailed me to congratulate me and were giving me tips on how to promote my petition. It was also being promoted on their main website front page as a trending petition. Then all of a sudden my petition is removed and my twitter account is suspended. Both care2petition.com and twitter refuse to respond to my emails to ascertain the reasons for the suspension, i am now permanently suspended from twitter which i must say is like a breath of fresh air,no more endless abuse from the morons that frequent that platform. Both of these so called freedom of speech platforms are the opposite of what they are supposed to represent. I will no longer have anything to do with either companies , they only allow freedom of speech if it fits within their own political agenda. I recommend everybody remove themselves from Twitter, i can confirm you will feel a lot less frustrated and happier in your life and hopefully twitter will eventually collapse and disappear for ever.

title: Zuckerburg's arbitrary and capricious political suspensions.
text: It's been two weeks now since the "keepers" of Twitter website suspended my Twitter account, accusing me of "multiple violations" of the "Twitter rules".  My Twitter account was at least 4 years old and I almost daily used it to express my political progressive leanings, including: criticizing Donald Trump, the Republican Party and several of Trump's minions; criticizing Israel's long standing brutality and racism enforced by its "Israel Defense Forces" and imposed on its "neighbors", the Palestinians; and criticizing the "leadership" of the Democratic Party.  I have repeatedly filed appeals to learn specifically why my account was suspended.  No response to date from Twitter. Consequently I obviously am the victim of Mark Zuckerburg's politics and his Twitter website which fails to specify which of its rules was "violated" and how and why any of my tweets "violated" the Twitter rules.  Absent much-needed regulation of Zuckerburg and his Twitter website, I must conclude that I surely am not alone as a victim of Zuckerburg's arbitrary and capricious political suspensions!

title: Twitter has its pros and cons and it…
text: Twitter has its pros and cons and it reflects a lot the modern society. On Twitter you are allowed to be yourself or whoever you want to be behind a user, that being said it's easy to find violent people spreading hate on this platform, using it to simply put others down. However, being anonymous allows a lot of people to express their selves freely and harmlessly, which is a mega positive point.  I've read some reviews on the political side of Twitter saying that it is strongly right-winged oriented, honestly, you get what you search for. The site is neither a right or left wing box, it is simply a box and looking through it you will find things you want and hate. A few problems with the Twitter algorithm suspending accounts randomly for no apparent reason is quite odd and that reason I took 1 star off this review. There is no clear communication! Sometimes you may have just started a new account and... BAM! It is suspended by no reason and you can't get it back. That truly needs some work.

title: Unfair and bad business practices; Twitter is not meant for brands and startups
text: I have a branded account for my business, and Twitter decided to suspend my account. Not to mention I have a trademark on my brand, licensing, etc to run my platform. Twitter does not investigate FALSE claims and they do not give you to have a FAIR chance to dispute anything (even if it was their mistake). It's basically a lose-lose situation because once it's done, it's done. Their automated process for re-investigating/counterclaims are just bogus - it's all automated OR they just refuse to take the time to investigate their mistakes. Twitter, you need to make some serious steps to helping and protecting business owners and branded accounts b/c competitors are putting in FALSE claims and you are not investigating them properly. Give people a fair chance to solve any issues instead of shutting down their account and ruining their brand.

title: One of my biggest regrets
text: I'm not what you call a social media animal to be honest, and I basically joined twitter for my then girlfriend at the time, because she was like "it will be so great, we can be more imitate with each other." It was a long distance relationship, which turned into a bad twitter romance, as I realized what a domineering, bullying, anti-social, narcissistic pig she was, which led to me airing a lot of dirty laundry on there, which is something I don't normally do, which caused a lot of stress for my mental health, and that's just the start of my gripe with this website.  Now, I can't speak about how twitter was 5-8 years ago, but from my perspective in 2018/2019 was that it was/is like a news media outlet website out to spread dread, and negativity, with fascist control over freedom of speech.  I'm an opinionated guy, always have been, and I got blocked without an explanation. I asked why they blocked me, they unblocked me a day later, and refused to tell me where the source of the complaint came from. I don't recall saying anything that offensive.  Social media has become a deadly poison, that I think it will continue to infect people that religiously use it as the years roll by, and it would affect their well being mentally. Social media makes us feel disconnected from the real world, so we lock all ourselves in this type of fantasy world, as form of escapism, which twitter doesn't really do, as it constantly promotes Brexit and Donald Trump, and other easy targets to bash until you get banned by the twitter police.  As for the people who use twitter are a lot of them are fake, shallow people, who are only looking for followers more so than actual communication with each other. I recall this one guy, I think his name was Jon Moses, a singer, I haven't a clue what he actually sings, or what his song style is, but he followed and unfollowed six times in a span of my first two months on twitter, so I end I had to block him, because I think in my opinion he was doing a form of trolling, which I didn't like, one thing I can't stand is attention seeking, drama queens. I had this quite a lot on twitter, people who follow you, expecting a follow back.  The final straw for me is when I got blocked by this girl who was talking about mental health, for no reason whatsoever. I followed because I was interested in her mental health posts, she for some reason took a dislike to me, so I got furious so I deleted my twitter account, because I got tired of wasting negative energy on there. So, a summary if you're a self-obsessed selfie queen who likes to take pics in the bathroom with your phone in the air, or you like to take pics of your pasta on a plate with your dirty mouth eating the stuff, then twitter is the place for you. If you like to post things like criticism, positive quotes, artwork or music, then that place is not for you. P.S Don't post pics of Satan that you've drawn yourself on there, they don't like that at all.

title: Abbotsinch tyre services, Kilmarnock
text: Visited the garage on the 2/12/18 to get a puncture repair, tyre had a temporary plug fitted. Waited at the reception desk. The person who was doing the puncture asked me to go with him to the workshop area. Shows me the tyre and states, is that TURNBULLS work when he saw the plug fitted. I said no, i fitted the plug 6 months prior. He runs his fingers through   loose rubber shavings and states the car has been running on its rim and the tyre is dangerous so cant fit a plug. I know the loose shavings came from me when i was repairing the tyre with a plug. The hole has to be roughened up prior to inserting the plug.. I had informed another member of staff to tell the guy working on the tyre (cant call him a fitter) to put 33 pounds pressure in the tyre. I had also said to Andrew that i cant run  a tyre flat, sensors warn me when pressure drops.When i started to reverse  the rear left tyre warning light was on. The car can also tell me tyre pressures. front left which he had checked for leak also had 38 lbs a square inch, rear left had 26 lbs a square inch, not 33lbs as requested. The work and diagnostics was so sub standard that when i got home i blew a tyre up myself and deflated  the other as  the pressure was over excessive and checked all wheel nuts. Overexcessive pressure can cause an accident when cornering as theres  less rubber on the road surface.Incidently i thought i would like to mention that i have worked as a mechanic most of my life and also done mots and furhermore my car only two day prior had just had its mot  which passed. Can only assume there trying to sell extra tyres before xmas. My tyre which was only half worn could have been sold of as a part  worn tyre which is a win win, well for them anyway, not me.. Felt  it was a fairer business when Andrews father had it in the old place. DEFINATELY a bad experience for me. I will repair the tyre myself, another plug should do it. With tyre pressure being to high on the front left made the car dangerous when i left the garage. If the rear tyre was much less than it was (26 lbs) it could have come away from the rim when cornering. How hard is it to blow a tyre up to the correct pressure? UPDATE----Have checked front left tyre and at the previous plug repair,useing a little water located a small leakat plug (bubbles) fitted another plug alongside and rechecked, leak stopped! On rear found a screw nail in tyre, removed screw with pliersand inserted plug, tested with water, no problem, all leaks repaired and pressure maintained. Would advice drivers to purchase a plug repair kit from e bay and a smal electric pump from Home Bargains for a fiver and your independant. Majority of repairs can be done with the wheel on the car. Repairing a puncture is not a difficult (well for most people)

title: Twitter support doesn't read tickets…
text: Twitter support doesn't read tickets but simply sends automated responses back. I'd imagine it's clear offshoring and lack of customer service. I had an active account suspended due to a bogus reason that I had "multiple accounts intended for abuse". I tried reaching out and showing them that those accounts were NOT intended for abuse and were used separately for different purposes, but I kept getting the same automated response. Until they decided with another automated response to not monitor my support tickets after many appeals. When my main account is clearly a legit account with many followers and I was clearly following all the rules and regulations for a long time. Aside from that, Twitter forces phone number verification and locks your accounts out on purpose. I believe Twitter is dying slowly and doesn't have a future. There's many alternative websites that one could use that offer better services and respect their users and their privacy more.

I had to get 'parental consent' and had to take pictures of mine and my mums identity (birth certificate, passport, driving license) and I get an email saying they're unable to unlock it. Are you joking me? there's enough proof that's my mother and we're related. Utter joke, twitter needs to sort this out because I'm overage to use it and I want my account back. Its embarrassing I have to take pictures of our identity just to say I had parental consent back then when I was underage.

title: I thought I'd try and use Twitter Ads
text: I thought I'd try and use Twitter Ads. As usual in their American way they say 'Hey, it's really simple to set up..' NO IT ISN'T! I was prompted to enter my credit card details and then it said 'Hey please wait while your account is being set up'. So I checked and I saw they'd decided I was going to spend £79 a month. I couldn't change it, I couldn't do anything. And how do these people get away with not having a contact phone number ANYWHERE!? It says 'Hey (they always say 'Hey') do you need help with billing? You click YES and they then say 'Is your question about  X, Y, or Z' And you say 'Y' and then they say is your question about and then they say and then you give up! They don't even have an email address, an online form - nothing. All they have is some kind of thing to tweet to something or other. How they get away with having NO PHONE NUMBER I don't know. I thought the Great God Google penalised companies without a contact number? Or is that just small companies that don't pay em money?

title: This company is the pits
text: This company is the pits! All that I wanted to do, with some urgency, was to get on Twitter to make sure that my nephew was safe since he was in Barcelona at the time of the terrorist attack. However, I was consistently blocked from accessing his team's Twitter account via Google, so I attempted to set up a Twitter account for myself (figuring that I would no longer be blocked). 'Got to a step in which I entered my phone # and was called with a code. Kept entering the code but, each time, I got an error message (although I was very careful to enter the correct code). Now I get a different error message that I've exceeded the number of permissible attempts, and I still can't get on Twitter. Tried to contact Customer Service but there's no phone help and the on-line help system is Byzantine, at best. It'll take me all night to wade through it and, I suspect, it still won't resolve my problem. Thanks, Twitter, for helping me to find my nephew after a terrorist attack. Now I just want to delete the account.

Twitter does not follow their own policy on inactive accounts - even after many years. It doesn't have any complaint mechanism and automated replies on other channels are irritatingly irrelevant and waste of time when a problem would take less than 10 seconds to investigate and solve.

title: Awful support when things go wrong
text: My account has been hacked and email changed but twitter support have been entirely useless saying they are unable to help unless I email them from the email address of the hacker. They are virtually impossible to contact, and then send random copy and paste emails that don't reflect the issue. When you complain they close the support ticket down.

title: Twitter - Platform of Limitations
text: Enough is enough. Twitter was a good site and service back in the day. Meanwhile it's just limitations and verifications everywhere. #1: Why do I need a phone verification to use Twitter? This is an online service. So, could someone explain to me, why sensitive private data not needed for the service is mandatory? #2: Next, with a brand new account, I want to follow a few people. Hitting the first follow, the button changes, a few seconds later the button changes back. Error message: "Sorry, something went wrong". Second day. Same problem still. So, brand new account. Following not possible. #3: LIMITing characters to 140, BUT ... #4: Replying to a first tweet is possible. Replying to a second tweet and offering a link for additional information, since Twitter is a HEADLINE ENGINE, NOT A SOCIAL MEDIUM(!) ... Error message. NOT POSSIBLE!!! #5: Entering a website. Website unacceptable. Here is the clue: just because "fraud" is in the domain name, the website links is "considered malware"! #6: Tweeting one or two links => account suspended. You could be a spammer. Congratulations Twitter! You know how to keep people away from your webiste. This is ridiculous! Do they want people to use the website or do they just want people to provide their private phone number and then leave and never come back again. Because that is what they make me do. So, back to Twitter. Deleting the phone number. And they never see me ever again.

title: Big time waster

title: Email linkt to random account, terrible support.
text: I have been trying to create a twitter profile, but every time it tells me that my email already is in use, thou I have never used twitter before. I request a password reset and received an email in Spanish of which I didn't understand anything. It turns out some other random dude somehow have his twitter account linked to my email.    Twitters support page is useless, everything just sends you in circles, and they have nothing about my specific problem. After about two hours I find a box to message twitter and explains my problem, asking them to unbind my email from the other persons account. Response from twitter: Try resetting your password. Totally useless, they apparently didn't even read what I wrote.   I write to them a second time and again I receive the same lousy standard "try resetting your password".   How can a company like Twitter let someone link another persons email to their account without some sort of verification.

title: Twitter udøver censur - Twitter is practicing censorship
text: Man siger, at vi lever i en verden med ytringsfrihed. Desværre er det ikke noget Twitter er helt enig i. Jeg er flere kontakter blandt andet i Brasilien, der har oplevet at blive blokket og direkte ekskluderet på baggrund af, at de åbenlyst har kritiseret den brasilianske regering. Et socialt medie, der ikke tilslutter sig en af de mest demokratiske principper, nemlig ytringsfriheden, bør efter min mening ikke have nogen eksistensberettigelse. Det kan ikke være rigtigt, at man ikke kan dele politiske synspunkter i mellem venner på Twitter, uden at blive blokket!! Det er dybt usmageligt!! >>>>>>   You say that we are living in a world with the freedom of speech. Unfortunately that is not something that Twitter agrees with. I have several contacts some of them from Brazil, who have experiences to be blocked and excluded as they openly have criticized the Brazilian government. A social media that does not become affiliated with the ground principles of the freedom to speech should as far as I am concerned not have the right to exist. It’s not right that you cannot share political points of view among friend on Twitter without being blocked!! That is completely distasteful!!

title: Marmite of Social Networks
text: You either "get" Twitter or you don't and it looks to me that most of the people reviewing it here "do not get it"! Twitter is not a standard "have a good birthday" or "look at this funny picture of me" social network.    Twitter is a stream of consciousness. A window in time onto the views of the world. It's a great place to read some very witty remarks - I sometime laugh out loud at my desk reading the answers to some trending topics. It's also a great place to get update on the news quickly. It's not all perfect, but if you can sort the wheat from the chaff you can get little gems very early!   If you "get it" then Twitter is just the best!

title: Brilliant.
text: Fed up of being poked on Facebook? Twitter is so much less invasive and personal details do not get shared with others. There is a massive list of sites to follow and you would be hard pushed not to find something of interest. Do you like shouting at the telly when politics or sport is on? Get on Twitter and let others know your opinions and comments, you may be surprised how many people share the same views.
